com.wx.util

Class Format

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.util.Format

  • public class Format
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods to format in a human readable way several units

      • formatTime

        public static java.lang.String formatTime(long time,
                                          boolean brief)
        Format in a human readable way a quantity of time.

        Optionally, it can be chosen if the units are displayed using their full names (eg. seconds, minutes,...) or using diminutives (eg. s, m, ...).

        Parameters:
        time - Time (in milliseconds) to format
        brief - If true, uses the diminutives for displaying the units
        Returns:
        The formatted time

      • formatSpeed

        public static java.lang.String formatSpeed(long duration,
                                           long size)
        Format in a human readable way a transfer speed.

        This method will calculate the speed to display according the given size transferred within the given duration.

        Parameters:
        duration - Duration (in milliseconds) of transfer
        size - Size (in bytes) of the transfer
        Returns:
        The formatted resulting speed
        See Also:
        formatSpeed(double)

      • formatSpeed

        public static java.lang.String formatSpeed(double speed)
        Format in a human readable way a transfer speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - Speed to format
        Returns:
        The formatted resulting speed

      • formatNumPrefix

        public static java.lang.String formatNumPrefix(int number,
                                               int digitsCount)
        Format a number ensuring that it always containing a minimal amount of digits (by prefixing with zeros if necessary).
        Parameters:
        number - Number to format
        digitsCount - Minimal number of digits
